as classified by franceinfo) |bars= {{bar pixel|Four-way runoffs|purple|1.25||5}} {{bar pixel|NFP–ENS–RN|blue|62.5||250}} {{bar pixel|NFP–LR–RN|blue|10.75||43}} {{bar pixel|Other three-way runoffs|blue|4||16}} {{bar pixel|NFP–RN|green|16.75||67}} {{bar pixel|RN–ENS|green|8||32}} {{bar pixel|LR–RN|green|7||28}} {{bar pixel|NFP–ENS|green|6.75||27}} {{bar pixel|LR–NFP|green|1.25||5}} {{bar pixel|LR–ENS|green|0.5||2}} {{bar pixel|Other duels|green|7.25||29}} {{bar pixel|Directly elected|orange|19||76}} }} Turnout in the first round of the legislative elections was exceptionally high, including 2.7 million proxy voting requests, with pollsters estimating the final turnout to be the highest for the first round of a legislative election since 1997 French legislative election|1997,{{cite news|title=Du jamais-vu depuis 46 ans à 17h : vers un taux de participation record pour les législatives ?|url=https://www.francetvinfo.fr/elections/legislatives/du-jamais-vu-depuis-43-ans-vers-un-taux-de-participation-record-pour-les-legislatives_6635610.html|access-date=30 June 2024|work=franceinfo|date=30 June 2024|archive-date=30 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240630125610/https://www.francetvinfo.fr/elections/legislatives/du-jamais-vu-depuis-43-ans-vers-un-taux-de-participation-record-pour-les-legislatives_6635610.html|url-status=live}}

sentences.text: On the basis of the first round results (not accounting for candidate withdrawals after the first round), 306 constituencies were headed to three-way runoffs and 5 to four-way runoffs,

references.text: <ref name="quadrangulaires"/> with only 89 three-way and 2 four-way runoffs remaining after candidate withdrawals announced ahead of the registration deadline for the second round.<ref name="LMwithdrawals"/> A total of 76 candidates were directly elected in the first round,<ref name="results2024"/> and RN-supported candidates qualified for the second round in 444 other constituencies, compared to 415 for the NFP, 321 for Ensemble, and 63 for LR (according to ''Le Monde'''s classifications of candidates by political affiliation).<ref name="LMresults">{{cite news|last1=Aubert|first1=Raphaëlle|last2=Sanchez|first2=Léa|last3=Breteau|first3=Pierre|last4=Romain|first4=Manon|last5=Ferrer|first5=Maxime|title=La carte des résultats des législatives au premier tour et le tableau des candidats qualifiés|url=https://www.lemonde.fr/les-decodeurs/article/2024/06/30/la-carte-des-resultats-des-legislatives-au-premier-tour-et-le-tableau-des-candidats-qualifies_6245574_4355771.html|access-date=30 June 2024|work=Le Monde|date=30 June 2024|language=fr|archive-date=1 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240701030827/https://www.lemonde.fr/les-decodeurs/article/2024/07/01/la-carte-des-resultats-des-legislatives-au-premier-tour-et-le-tableau-des-candidats-qualifies_6245574_4355771.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: In an interview with Cyril Hanouna on Europe 1 on 24 June, Minister for Gender Equality, Diversity and Equal Opportunities|Gender Equality Minister Aurore Bergé, like Emmanuel Macron, declined to specify second-round voting instructions between either the New Popular Front (NFP) and National Rally (RN) while also implying that any such discussions would not take place until after the first round.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news|title=Cyril Hanouna – "Le meilleur rempart contre le Front Populaire c'est nous !", affirme Aurore Bergé|url=https://www.europe1.fr/emissions/on-marche-sur-la-tete/cyril-hanouna-le-meilleur-rempart-contre-le-front-populaire-cest-nous-declare-aurore-berge-4254521|access-date=25 June 2024|work=Europe 1|date=24 June 2024|archive-date=25 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625020735/https://www.europe1.fr/emissions/on-marche-sur-la-tete/cyril-hanouna-le-meilleur-rempart-contre-le-front-populaire-cest-nous-declare-aurore-berge-4254521|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="Berge"/> Both of Renaissance (French political party)|Renaissance's alliance partners' leaders, François Bayrou of the Democratic Movement (France)|Democratic Movement (MoDem) and Édouard Philippe of Horizons (political party)|Horizons, also refused to address the issue, with allies of Macron reportedly divided on this question.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Herbemont|first1=Aurélie|title=Législatives 2024 : le camp présidentiel s'interroge sur la position à tenir en cas de duel RN – Nouveau Front populaire|url=https://www.francetvinfo.fr/replay-radio/le-brief-politique/legislatives-2024-le-camp-presidentiel-s-interroge-sur-la-position-a-tenir-en-cas-de-duel-rn-nouveau-front-populaire_6587058.html|access-date=25 June 2024|work=franceinfo|date=20 June 2024|archive-date=25 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625024403/https://www.francetvinfo.fr/replay-radio/le-brief-politique/legislatives-2024-le-camp-presidentiel-s-interroge-sur-la-position-a-tenir-en-cas-de-duel-rn-nouveau-front-populaire_6587058.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: On the afternoon of 25 June, Macron and the leaders of Renaissance, MoDem, Horizons, the Union of Democrats and Independents (UDI), the Radical Party (France)|Radical Party, and several other members of his coterie met to discuss the matter, with a general consensus emerging among participants to call to block the RN and La France Insoumise (LFI) candidates in the second round and potentially withdraw on a case-by-case basis, though no decision was reached by the end of the meeting. Interviewed on the evening of 26 June, Bayrou remarked, "we will vote for neither a National Rally nor LFI candidate ... why have the political forces, which I consider to be republicans, gone and settled themselves under the yoke of a very radical, brutal, violent far-left?"<ref name="Pradie"/> Philippe then called on all third-placed Horizons candidates who advanced to give up their candidacy in the second round.<ref name="LMlive"/>

references.text: <ref name="LP0625">{{cite news|last1=Théveniaud|first1=Pauline|title=Législatives : après une réunion avec Macron, le camp présidentiel vers un " ni RN, ni LFI " au second tour|url=https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-apres-une-reunion-avec-macron-le-camp-presidentiel-vers-un-ni-rn-ni-lfi-au-second-tour-25-06-2024-URNVFUPA25DHTCHF5QJAAEO5PA.php|access-date=25 June 2024|work=Le Parisien|date=25 June 2024|archive-date=30 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240630224736/https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-apres-une-reunion-avec-macron-le-camp-presidentiel-vers-un-ni-rn-ni-lfi-au-second-tour-25-06-2024-URNVFUPA25DHTCHF5QJAAEO5PA.php|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: Marine Tondelier, leader of The Ecologists (political party)|The Ecologists, announced in an interview the same day that candidates from her party would withdraw if they were eligible to advance to the second round but finished in third place, a view also shared by Raphaël Glucksmann of Place Publique. LFI Member of European Parliament|MEP Manon Aubry stated that the decisions of LFI candidates in three-way races would be made on a case-by-case basis. Socialist Party (France)|Socialist Party leader Olivier Faure, along with Glucksmann, Tondelier, and two government ministers (Clément Beaune and Agnès Pannier-Runacher) signed onto an open letter published in ''Le Monde'' on 25 June pushing for all parties facing to reach an agreement to withdraw candidates in order to block the RN, though no LFI representatives signed onto the letter. On 26 June, Jean-Luc Mélenchon indicated that LFI would issue voting instructions after the first round and told his supporters to not vote for the RN.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news|last1=Lecach|first1=Marianne|title=Législatives : les candidats écologistes prêts à se désister au second tour pour faire échouer le RN|url=https://www.lejdd.fr/politique/legislatives-les-candidats-ecologistes-prets-se-desister-au-second-tour-pour-faire-echouer-le-rn-146763|access-date=25 June 2024|work=Le Journal du Dimanche|date=24 June 2024|archive-date=24 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624223750/https://www.lejdd.fr/politique/legislatives-les-candidats-ecologistes-prets-se-desister-au-second-tour-pour-faire-echouer-le-rn-146763|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|title=Législatives : en cas de triangulaire, le moins bien placé face au RN devra se retirer, selon Glucksmann|url=https://www.challenges.fr/politique/legislatives-en-cas-de-triangulaire-le-moins-bien-place-face-au-rn-devra-se-retirer-selon-glucksmann_897177|access-date=25 June 2024|work=Challenges|agency=Agence France-Presse|date=21 June 2024|archive-date=30 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240630212555/https://www.challenges.fr/politique/legislatives-en-cas-de-triangulaire-le-moins-bien-place-face-au-rn-devra-se-retirer-selon-glucksmann_897177|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|title=En direct, législatives 2024 : « Rien ne me choque », déclare Eric Ciotti à propos du programme du Rassemblement national|url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/06/25/en-direct-legislatives-2024-suivez-la-campagne-et-les-reactions-avant-le-premier-debat-televise_6243506_823448.html|access-date=25 June 2024|work=Le Monde|date=25 June 2024|archive-date=25 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625052451/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/06/25/en-direct-legislatives-2024-suivez-la-campagne-et-les-reactions-avant-le-premier-debat-televise_6243506_823448.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|title=Législatives 2024 : plus de 220 personnalités réclament un accord de désistement face au RN|url=https://www.ouest-france.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-2024-plus-de-220-personnalites-reclament-un-accord-de-desistement-face-au-rn-9b455068-32c5-11ef-8462-4d5d263c07bc|access-date=25 June 2024|work=Ouest-France|date=25 June 2024|archive-date=25 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625081602/https://www.ouest-france.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-2024-plus-de-220-personnalites-reclament-un-accord-de-desistement-face-au-rn-9b455068-32c5-11ef-8462-4d5d263c07bc|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="LPFaure"/> In a press release on 27 June, the French Communist Party (PCF) confirmed that it would instruct its voters to support a "republican candidate" against the RN in the second round, and that its candidates would withdraw if they advanced to the second round but finished third in the first.<ref name="LFPCF">{{cite news|title=EN DIRECT – Législatives 2024 : le RN a établi une liste de 50 postes interdits aux binationaux|url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/en-direct-legislatives-2024-une-majorite-de-francais-redoute-des-manifestations-violentes-20240627|access-date=27 June 2024|work=Le Figaro|date=27 June 2024|archive-date=27 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240627112924/https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/en-direct-legislatives-2024-une-majorite-de-francais-redoute-des-manifestations-violentes-20240627|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: While he was opposed to the prospect of an alliance between The Republicans (France)|The Republicans (LR) and the National Rally, LR vice president François-Xavier Bellamy declared that he would support candidates of the RN against those of the NFP in the second round, even in the case that they were not LFI candidates. In an interview on 26 June, Julien Aubert declared that he would vote for any candidate against the RN in most cases, but would vote for them if faced with a LFI candidate.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news|last1=Sdiri|first1=Noah|title=Législatives : Bellamy voterait "bien sûr" pour le RN face à la gauche au second tour|url=https://www.lejdd.fr/politique/legislatives-bellamy-voterait-bien-sur-pour-le-rn-face-la-gauche-au-second-tour-146338|access-date=25 June 2024|work=Le Journal du Dimanche|date=13 June 2024|archive-date=27 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240627013438/https://www.lejdd.fr/politique/legislatives-bellamy-voterait-bien-sur-pour-le-rn-face-la-gauche-au-second-tour-146338|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="Pradie">{{cite news|title=EN DIRECT – Législatives 2024 : la France plongée dans une crise «sans précédent», s'alarme le Cese|url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/en-direct-legislatives-2024-a-j-4-du-premier-tour-aurelien-pradie-quitte-les-republicains-20240626|access-date=26 June 2024|work=Le Figaro|date=26 June 2024|archive-date=26 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240626063200/https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/en-direct-legislatives-2024-a-j-4-du-premier-tour-aurelien-pradie-quitte-les-republicains-20240626|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: A story published by ''Le Monde'' on 5 July suggested that Attal spearheaded the anti-RN blockade to Macron's chagrin, with the latter annoyed by Attal's relative independence. Macron also called Ensemble candidates to pressure them to not drop out up until the last moment, with his inner circle reportedly becoming more comfortable with the idea of an RN victory even as Attal warned about the dangers of the far-right coming to power.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news|last1=Gatinois|first1=Claire|last2=Segaunes|first2=Nathalie|last3=Trippenbach|first3=Ivanne|title=Législatives 2024 : entre l'Elysée et Matignon, tensions sur le front républicain|url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/article/2024/07/05/legislatives-2024-entre-l-elysee-et-matignon-tensions-sur-le-front-republicain_6247185_823448.html|access-date=5 July 2024|work=Le Monde|date=5 July 2024|archive-date=6 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240706000911/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/article/2024/07/05/legislatives-2024-entre-l-elysee-et-matignon-tensions-sur-le-front-republicain_6247185_823448.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: Mélenchon ultimately announced that all third-placed candidates of the New Popular Front who advanced to the second round in constituencies where the RN placed first would stand down. In duels between left-of-centre candidates, the PS called for voters to support the higher-placed candidate, as well as for the withdrawal of lower-placed candidates, a view also echoed by the leadership of the French Communist Party.

references.text: <ref name="LMlive">{{cite news|title=En direct, résultats législatives 2024 : le RN et ses alliés (34 %) devancent la coalition de gauche du NFP (28,1 %) et le camp présidentiel (20,3 %)|url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/06/30/en-direct-resultats-legislatives-2024-paroles-d-electeurs-c-est-tellement-important-cette-fois_6245488_823448.html|access-date=30 June 2024|work=Le Monde|date=30 June 2024|archive-date=30 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240630183832/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/06/30/en-direct-resultats-legislatives-2024-paroles-d-electeurs-c-est-tellement-important-cette-fois_6245488_823448.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|title=Législatives : les propos controversés de certains candidats " n'ont pas leur place au sein du RN ", assure Jordan Bardella|url=https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/direct-legislatives-la-campagne-dans-sa-ligne-droite-finale-macron-reunit-le-conseil-des-ministres-03-07-2024-MCEYQOGFJJHSLLPF4QSVVILWUQ.php|access-date=3 July 2024|work=Le Parisien|date=3 July 2024|archive-date=6 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240706000909/https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/direct-legislatives-la-campagne-dans-sa-ligne-droite-finale-macron-reunit-le-conseil-des-ministres-03-07-2024-MCEYQOGFJJHSLLPF4QSVVILWUQ.php|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: According to RN deputy Sébastien Chenu, a number of deputies, including those belonging to Ensemble, reached out to ask third-placed RN candidates to withdraw in order to block candidates of the left from winning in the second round, a request which Chenu indicated the party's leadership would consider.

references.text: <ref name="LMlive2">{{cite news|title=En direct, législatives 2024 : Bruno Le Maire appelle à « voter pour un candidat du camp social-démocrate » dont il exclut La France insoumise|url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/01/en-direct-resultats-des-legislatives-suivez-la-campagne-d-entre-deux-tours-et-posez-vos-questions_6245747_823448.html|access-date=1 July 2024|work=Le Monde|date=1 July 2024|archive-date=1 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240701051326/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/01/en-direct-resultats-des-legislatives-suivez-la-campagne-d-entre-deux-tours-et-posez-vos-questions_6245747_823448.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: According to the classifications of ''Le Monde'', 89 three-way and 2 four-way runoffs remained after the publicly announced withdrawals of 134 NFP-supported and 82 Ensemble-supported candidates. All but 5 NFP candidates withdrew in races where they placed 3rd or below in the first round and RN-backed candidates also qualified, compared to 15 Ensemble candidates (of which 9 were in races where LFI qualified) and 12 The Republicans (France)|The Republicans or miscellaneous right candidates (of which 5 were in races where LFI qualified) in the same situation.

references.text: <ref name="LMwithdrawals">{{cite news|last1=Breteau|first1=Pierre|last2=Vaudano|first2=Maxime|last3=Derœux|first3=Iris|last4=Parienté|first4=Jonathan|last5=Berhouet|first5=Patxi|last6=Geoffroy|first6=Romain|title=Législatives 2024 : qui sera candidat au second tour après les désistements ? Suivez le décompte en temps réel|url=https://www.lemonde.fr/les-decodeurs/article/2024/07/01/legislatives-2024-qui-sera-candidat-au-second-tour-suivez-le-decompte-en-temps-reel_6245837_4355771.html|access-date=2 July 2024|work=Le Monde|date=1 July 2024|language=fr|archive-date=1 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240701155239/https://www.lemonde.fr/les-decodeurs/article/2024/07/01/legislatives-2024-qui-sera-candidat-au-second-tour-suivez-le-decompte-en-temps-reel_6245837_4355771.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="results2024"/><ref name="LMwithdrawals"/> Two candidates who also initially registered for the second round – Dominique Despras in Rhône's 8th constituency and France Moreau in Maine-et-Loire's 5th constituency – changed their mind after finding out about other candidates' registrations in the second round. Because they were unable to officially withdraw at this point, they declined to submit any of their paper ballots, meaning that voters did not find paper ballots with the name of either candidate at polling stations.<ref>{{cite news|title=Législatives 2024 : triangulaires, désistements, report de voix… À quoi va ressembler le second tour ?|url=https://www.sudouest.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-2024-triangulaires-desistements-report-de-voix-a-quoi-va-ressembler-le-second-tour-20407246.php|access-date=3 July 2024|work=Sud Ouest|agency=Agence France-Presse|date=3 July 2024|archive-date=4 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240704063257/https://www.sudouest.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-2024-triangulaires-desistements-report-de-voix-a-quoi-va-ressembler-le-second-tour-20407246.php|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: Provisional results placed turnout in the second round at 66.63%, the highest level since 1997 French legislative election|1997.<ref name="results2024"/>

references.text: <ref>{{Cite tweet|last=Gallard|first=Mathieu|user=mathieugallard|number=1809969496733384841|date=7 July 2024|title=🇫🇷🗳️ L'estimation de la participation finale par les différents instituts : Ifop : 67,5% Harris : 67,1% Elabe : 67,1% OpinionWay : 67% Ipsos : 67% Plus de cohérence qu'au premier tour 🙃|access-date=7 July 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: Contrary to pre-election projections, NFP-supported candidates won the largest number of seats after the second round, with Ensemble candidates also beating expectations by coming second ahead of RN-supported candidates in third, trailed by LR candidates in fourth place. According to candidate labeling by the Minister of the Interior (France)|Ministry of the Interior, candidates belonging to NFP parties received 180<!-- PLEASE DO NOT CHANGE, see footnote B: calculated according to the official figures of the Ministry of the Interior, NOT according to the unofficial candidate classifications created by various other media outlets --> seats (well short of the 289 needed for a majority),{{efn|name="NFPtotal"}} compared to 159<!-- PLEASE DO NOT CHANGE, see footnote C: calculated according to the official figures of the Ministry of the Interior, NOT according to the unofficial candidate classifications created by various other media outlets --> for those belonging to Ensemble parties,{{efn|name="Etotal"}} 142 for RN-supported candidates, and 39 for LR candidates, resulting in no party controlling a parliamentary majority. Unofficial media classifications of candidates' affiliations may differ slightly from those used by the Ministry of Interior: according to ''Le Monde'''s analysis, 182 NFP-affiliated candidates were elected, compared with 168 for Ensemble, 143 for the RN, and 45 for LR,

references.text: <ref name="LMlive6"/><ref name="results2024"/> with 80 constituencies shifting rightwards and 75 shifting leftwards.<ref name="LMlive7"/> The PS more than doubled its number of elected deputies compared to 2022 and the RN gained the second-most seats, while Renaissance suffered the most significant losses of any individual party.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Marchal |first1=Raphaël |last2=Kagni |first2=Maxence |title=Législatives 2024 : Quels équilibres au sein des blocs de la nouvelle Assemblée nationale ? |url=https://lcp.fr/actualites/legislatives-2024-quels-equilibres-au-sein-des-blocs-de-la-nouvelle-assemblee-nationale |access-date=9 July 2024 |work=LCP |date=8 July 2024 |archive-date=9 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240709000846/https://lcp.fr/actualites/legislatives-2024-quels-equilibres-au-sein-des-blocs-de-la-nouvelle-assemblee-nationale |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |last1=Wiels |first1=Jason |last2=Marchal |first2=Raphaël |title=Les principales forces politiques en présence à l'Assemblée nationale en chiffres |url=https://lcp.fr/actualites/les-principales-forces-politiques-en-presence-a-l-assemblee-nationale-en-chiffres-122925 |access-date=9 July 2024 |work=LCP |date=20 June 2022 |archive-date=9 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240709084502/https://lcp.fr/actualites/les-principales-forces-politiques-en-presence-a-l-assemblee-nationale-en-chiffres-122925 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: An Ipsos survey suggested that the "Republican Front (French Fifth Republic)|republican front" against the RN remained fairly strong in the second round, with first-round NFP voters supporting Ensemble candidates over RN ones by a 72%–3% margin in second-round duels and first-round Ensemble voters supporting PS/LE/PCF candidates over RN ones by a 54%–15% margin in second-round duels. NFP voters also backed LR candidates over RN ones in second-round duels by a 70%–2% margin, and Ensemble voters by a 79%–4% margin. Even in the case of LFI–RN duels, first-round Ensemble voters supported LFI candidates over RN ones by a 43%–19% margin.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news|last1=Berrod|first1=Nicolas|title=Législatives 2024 : le « front républicain » a-t-il marché ? Découvrez les reports de voix au second tour|url=https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-2024-le-front-republicain-a-t-il-marche-decouvrez-les-reports-de-voix-au-second-tour-07-07-2024-PH4OJQ4RZZGGDLHABPFRE7ILAE.php|access-date=7 July 2024|work=Le Parisien|date=7 July 2024|archive-date=8 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240708153140/https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-2024-le-front-republicain-a-t-il-marche-decouvrez-les-reports-de-voix-au-second-tour-07-07-2024-PH4OJQ4RZZGGDLHABPFRE7ILAE.php|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: The number of women elected to the National Assembly declined for the second election in a row, from 215 in 2022 to 208 (36%), with the NFP having the highest share at 41% followed by Ensemble with 39%, RN-supported deputies with 32%, and LR with 27%. The average age of the National Assembly remained similar at 49 years and 2 months, with the RN having both the youngest (Flavien Termet, 22) and oldest (José Gonzalez (French politician)|José Gonzalez, 81) deputies. The average age of the RN-supported and NFP deputies was 47, compared to 51 for Ensemble and 52 for LR. Out of the 577 elected deputies, 408 were re-elected, with the highest rate of re-election for Ensemble and LR deputies (both roughly 84.5%) followed by NFP (63%) and RN-supported (57%) deputies. The managerial and professional class is overwhelmingly overrepresented among these 577 deputies, accounting for more than 60% of all new elected officials, with this percentage being similar among all four of the largest groupings. Only three blue-collar workers were elected (0.5% of the National Assembly), compared to their share of 19% in the overall population.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |last1=Imbach |first1=Romain |last2=Geoffroy |first2=Romain |title=Age, sexe, profession : qui sont les nouveaux députés ? |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/les-decodeurs/article/2024/07/08/age-sexe-profession-qui-sont-les-nouveaux-deputes_6247938_4355770.html |access-date=9 July 2024 |work=Le Monde |date=8 July 2024 |archive-date=9 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240709114211/https://www.lemonde.fr/les-decodeurs/article/2024/07/08/age-sexe-profession-qui-sont-les-nouveaux-deputes_6247938_4355770.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: For the first time in their history, the RN managed to elect candidates in List of constituencies of the National Assembly of France#Overseas: 27 constituencies|overseas constituencies: Anchya Bamana, contesting in Mayotte's 2nd constituency, and Joseph Rivière (politician)|Joseph Rivière, running in Réunion's 3rd constituency, both won a seat in the National Assembly.<ref name=":02"/> The result in Mayotte was linked to the 2024 Mayotte crisis|political crisis affecting the region earlier in 2024.<ref name=":12"/>

references.text: <ref name=":02">{{Cite web|date=7 July 2024|title=Résultats des législatives 2024 à Mayotte et à la Réunion : le RN envoie ses deux premiers députés ultramarins à l'Assemblée nationale|url=https://www.liberation.fr/politique/elections/resultats-des-legislatives-2024-a-mayotte-et-a-la-reunion-le-rn-envoie-ses-deux-premiers-deputes-ultramarins-a-lassemblee-nationale-20240707_D6KOJBXY6FAI7PZMNV25YNVSOI/|access-date=8 July 2024|website=Libération|language=fr|archive-date=8 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240708003627/https://www.liberation.fr/politique/elections/resultats-des-legislatives-2024-a-mayotte-et-a-la-reunion-le-rn-envoie-ses-deux-premiers-deputes-ultramarins-a-lassemblee-nationale-20240707_D6KOJBXY6FAI7PZMNV25YNVSOI/|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name=":12">{{Cite web|date=8 July 2024|title=Cinque risultati sorprendenti dalle elezioni in Francia|url=https://www.ilpost.it/2024/07/08/elezioni-francesi-vittoria-sinistra/|access-date=8 July 2024|website=Il Post|language=it|archive-date=10 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240710214744/https://www.ilpost.it/2024/07/08/elezioni-francesi-vittoria-sinistra/|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: Emmanuel Tjibaou, the son of late Kanak people|Kanak independence leader Jean-Marie Tjibaou, was elected to the National Assembly for New Caledonia's 2nd constituency: in the process, he became the first Pro-independence movement|pro-independence candidate to win a seat since 1986, and his victory was seen as a setback for the French loyalist movement in New Caledonia, in the aftermath of the 2024 New Caledonia unrest|civil unrest across the archipelago earlier in the year.

sentences.text:
{{see also|2024-2025 French political crisis}}
In his year-end address on 31 December 2024, Macron acknowledged that calling the election had "brought more division in the (National) Assembly than solutions for the French" and added that "I take my full part for that".

references.text: <ref>{{cite news|last1=Leicester |first1=John |title=France’s Macron acknowledges that dissolving parliament in 2024 backfired but celebrates Olympics |url=https://apnews.com/article/france-macron-olympics-notre-dame-new-year-elections-33f053c0b06db550d177bb89357a0ba5 |access-date=1 January 2025 |work=AP News |date=1 January 2025}}</ref>

sentences.text: Due to the tripolarisation of the electorate, unprecedented institutional deadlock is a significant possibility if no bloc proves able to secure a majority of votes in the National Assembly to insulate themselves from a motion of no confidence. Snap elections can only be called at least a year after the previous legislative election under the Constitution of France|constitution. Some analysts also envisaged the possibility of an Technocratic government (Italy)|Italian-style technocratic government or a 2019–2020 Belgian government formation#Formateur Sophie Wilmès (16 March 2020 – 17 March 2020)|2020 Belgian-like temporary minority government of independent figures prior to a second snap election.

references.text: <ref name="LEMazuir">{{cite news|last1=Mazuir|first1=Valérie|title=Législatives 2024 : les scénarios de l'après-7 juillet|url=https://www.lesechos.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-2024-les-scenarios-de-lapres-7-juillet-2102694|access-date=30 June 2024|work=Les Echos|date=20 June 2024|archive-date=29 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240629090814/https://www.lesechos.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-2024-les-scenarios-de-lapres-7-juillet-2102694|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dupont|first1=Laureline|title=Quel gouvernement après le 7 juillet ? Les trois scénarios secrets sur la table de Macron|url=https://www.lexpress.fr/politique/quel-gouvernement-apres-le-7-juillet-les-trois-scenarios-secrets-sur-la-table-de-macron-ZXM23QT27VDTDLQSS7KNRT6MZM/|access-date=30 June 2024|work=L'Express|date=26 June 2024|archive-date=29 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240629155141/https://www.lexpress.fr/politique/quel-gouvernement-apres-le-7-juillet-les-trois-scenarios-secrets-sur-la-table-de-macron-ZXM23QT27VDTDLQSS7KNRT6MZM/|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: Attal announced that he would resign as prime minister just after the results were announced. Macron was not required to accept Attal's resignation, and the latter noted that he would be willing to remain in his post as long as necessary, and Macron ultimately refused his resignation "for the time being" on the morning of 8 July. Macron accepted his resignation on 16 July,<ref name="LPlive"/> allowing ministers to vote for the president of the National Assembly while remaining in place as a caretaker government.<ref name="LMlive14"/>

references.text: <ref>{{cite news|last1=Guez|first1=Ariel|title=Législatives: Emmanuel Macron peut-il refuser la démission de Gabriel Attal après l'annonce des résultats?|url=https://www.bfmtv.com/politique/elections/legislatives/legislatives-emmanuel-macron-peut-il-refuser-la-demission-de-gabriel-attal-apres-l-annonce-des-resultats_AV-202407070580.html|access-date=8 July 2024|work=BFMTV|date=7 July 2024|archive-date=10 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240710214750/https://www.bfmtv.com/politique/elections/legislatives/legislatives-emmanuel-macron-peut-il-refuser-la-demission-de-gabriel-attal-apres-l-annonce-des-resultats_AV-202407070580.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="LMlive7"/> In a letter published in the regional press on 10 July, Macron declared that "nobody won" the elections and added that the current government would remain in place until it was clear that a new "necessarily plural" government of "political forces that recognise themselves in republican institutions" could be formed,<ref name="LMlive9"/> with leading figures on the left decrying the letter as a "refus[al] to recognise the result of the elections" showing that Macron was "in denial" and attempting a "democratic coup" by signaling that he would not allow the NFP to lead the next government if it included LFI members.<ref>{{cite news |title=DIRECT. Lettre aux Français : Emmanuel Macron "refuse de reconnaître le résultat des urnes", juge Jean-Luc Mélenchon |url=https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/direct-legislatives-les-deputes-rn-et-modem-font-leur-entree-a-lassemblee-ce-mercredi-10-07-2024-ZEV6NCDEFZFEHAQU2B52B4KU4Y.php |access-date=10 July 2024 |work=Le Parisien |date=10 July 2024 |archive-date=13 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240713031503/https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/direct-legislatives-les-deputes-rn-et-modem-font-leur-entree-a-lassemblee-ce-mercredi-10-07-2024-ZEV6NCDEFZFEHAQU2B52B4KU4Y.php |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: In an interview on 1 July, Aurore Bergé signaled openness to a coalition with members of other parties, including "the Republicans who didn't want to corrupt themselves with Éric Ciotti and with the RN, with certain members of the Socialist Party, the ecologists, the communists," Interviewed on 8 July, Darmanin envisaged the possibility of cooperation with the PS on some issues where they differed from LFI,<ref name="LMlive7"/> but went on to add that he was opposed to working with ecologist deputies.<ref name="LMlive9"/> On 9 July, several Renaissance deputies threatened to file a motion of no confidence in the event that the next government included LFI deputies, and in the face of these threats and Attal's continuation as prime minister, the NFP warned Macron "against any attempt to hijack the institutions."<ref name="LMlive8"/>

references.text: <ref name="LMlive2"/> a view shared by the leader of alliance partner Horizons (political party)|Horizons Édouard Philippe.<ref name="LFlive"/> Philippe called for an "agreement which will stabilise the political situation" excluding LFI and the RN. Séjourné likewise excluded the possibility of governing alongside Mélenchon and some of his allies on the left, saying that there would be certain prerequisites for any potential coalition.<ref name="LMlive6">{{cite news|title=En direct, résultats des législatives 2024 : aucune prise de parole d'Emmanuel Macron attendue ce soir « à ce stade », selon l'Elysée|url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/07/en-direct-legislatives-2024-on-sait-que-ca-va-impacter-nos-vies_6247441_823448.html|access-date=7 July 2024|work=Le Monde|date=7 July 2024|archive-date=10 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240710214747/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/10/en-direct-assemblee-nationale-melenchon-estime-que-macron-doit-s-incliner-face-au-nfp-le-pen-denonce-un-cirque-indigne-apres-la-lettre-du-president_6247441_823448.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: A number of key figures indicated their preference for working with the right rather than the left, with Philippe arguing for a "technical agreement" but not coalition with LR in addition to Darmanin publicly stating that "the country is on the right[, so] we must govern on the right," and Macron reportedly met with LR Senate president Gérard Larcher on the evening of 8 July. Bergé and Darmanin both publicly appealed for the support of LR deputies the following day, with the latter also confirming that he would also vote for a motion of no confidence against a NFP government, but Bayrou was less receptive to the idea, suggesting that he preferred a coalition which still involved some figures from the left.

references.text: <ref name="LMlive8"/><ref>{{cite news |last1=Jacquot |first1=Guillaume |title=Législatives : les macronistes entament de longues tractations pour tenter de faire émerger une coalition centrale |url=https://www.publicsenat.fr/actualites/politique/legislatives-les-macronistes-entament-de-longues-tractations-pour-tenter-de-faire-emerger-une-coalition-centrale |access-date=9 July 2024 |work=Public Sénat |date=8 July 2024 |archive-date=9 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240709105733/https://www.publicsenat.fr/actualites/politique/legislatives-les-macronistes-entament-de-longues-tractations-pour-tenter-de-faire-emerger-une-coalition-centrale |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="LMlive9">{{cite news |title=En direct, Assemblée nationale : Emmanuel Macron conditionne la nomination d'un premier ministre à la création d'une majorité " nécessairement plurielle " à l'Assemblée nationale |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/10/en-direct-legislatives-2024-les-deputes-renaissance-favorables-a-une-coalition-de-projet-allant-des-sociaux-democrates-a-la-droite-de-gouvernement_6247441_823448.html |access-date=10 July 2024 |work=Le Monde |date=10 July 2024 |archive-date=10 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240710214747/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/10/en-direct-assemblee-nationale-melenchon-estime-que-macron-doit-s-incliner-face-au-nfp-le-pen-denonce-un-cirque-indigne-apres-la-lettre-du-president_6247441_823448.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: On 2 July, LFI national coordinator Manuel Bompard announced that his party would not participate in a grand coalition including LFI and Ensemble, and Attal likewise ruled out the possibility of a coalition with LFI. Just after the second round, Mélenchon called for the appointment of a prime minister from the left, echoed by Tondelier and Faure, who said that the NFP intended to govern and would not support any Ensemble-led coalition. and Sandrine Rousseau pledged not to repeatedly invoke article 49 of the French Constitution#Commitment of responsibility on a bill (49.3)|article 49.3 unlike recent governments.

references.text: <ref name="LFlive">{{cite news|title=EN DIRECT – Élections législatives 2024 : «Le gouvernement est prêt», assure Marine Le Pen, qui confirme qu'elle n'en fera pas partie|url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/en-direct-elections-legislatives-2024-circonscriptions-sondages-second-tour-20240702|access-date=2 July 2024|work=Le Figaro|issue=2 July 2024|archive-date=2 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240702064908/https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/en-direct-elections-legislatives-2024-circonscriptions-sondages-second-tour-20240702|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="LMlive3"/> Tondelier declined to rule out the possibility of participating in a coalition but indicated her desire not to do so and her opposition to a Macron-aligned prime minister.<ref>{{cite news|title=EN DIRECT – Élections législatives 2024 : «On a perdu un trimestre de croissance» à cause de l'instabilité politique, lance le patron des petites et moyennes entreprises|url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/en-direct-elections-legislatives-2024-resultats-sondages-7-juillet-circonscriptions-candidats-20240703|access-date=3 July 2024|work=Le Figaro|date=3 July 2024|archive-date=3 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240703090911/https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/en-direct-elections-legislatives-2024-resultats-sondages-7-juillet-circonscriptions-candidats-20240703|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|title=EN DIRECT – Législatives: malgré les sondages en baisse, Bardella reste "confiant"|url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/en-direct-legislatives-2024-sondages-resultats-deuxieme-tour-candidat-20240705|access-date=5 July 2024|work=Le Figaro|date=5 July 2024|archive-date=5 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240705072719/https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/en-direct-legislatives-2024-sondages-resultats-deuxieme-tour-candidat-20240705|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="LMlive6"/> Yannick Jadot announced that the NFP would propose its government the week of the second round, Faure declared that the alliance would agree upon a name for prime minister by then, Bompard said that the NFP would implement its programme in its entirety,<ref name="LMlive7">{{cite news|title=En direct, législatives 2024 : les dirigeants du Nouveau Front populaire veulent présenter « une candidature » au poste de premier ministre « dans la semaine »|url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/08/en-direct-legislatives-2024-gabriel-attal-doit-presenter-lundi-sa-demission-a-emmanuel-macron_6247441_823448.html|access-date=8 July 2024|work=Le Monde|date=8 July 2024|archive-date=8 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240708081052/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/08/en-direct-legislatives-2024-gabriel-attal-doit-presenter-lundi-sa-demission-a-emmanuel-macron_6247441_823448.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|title=DIRECT. Législatives : " Nous laissons l'Assemblée nationale se constituer ", indique l'entourage de Macron|url=https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-le-nouveau-front-populaire-majoritaire-a-lassemblee-attal-presente-sa-demission-suivez-notre-direct-au-lendemain-du-second-tour-ce-matin-08-07-2024-22ARSNVTXRAP5GUTYJLKN3HU7I.php|access-date=8 July 2024|work=Le Parisien|date=8 July 2024|archive-date=8 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240708153711/https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-le-nouveau-front-populaire-majoritaire-a-lassemblee-attal-presente-sa-demission-suivez-notre-direct-au-lendemain-du-second-tour-ce-matin-08-07-2024-22ARSNVTXRAP5GUTYJLKN3HU7I.php|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: PS alliance negotiator Johanna Rolland, along with Carole Delga, welcomed the potential support of the leftmost Ensemble deputies in a NFP-led coalition, Huguette Bello emerged as a possible name for prime minister on 12 July, proposed by Roussel but resisted by the PS, which failed to approve Bello's candidacy on 13 July and called for further discussions. a hypothesis publicly rejected by LFI figureheads as too "Macron-compatible." Tubiana dismissed the possibility of becoming prime minister on 22 July. On 23 July, the NFP announced that it would propose 37-year-old civil servant Lucie Castets, director of finance and purchasing for the city of Paris, for the post of prime minister, though Macron will not appoint a new government until mid-August at earliest and noted that the question was not of the name for prime minister but rather the ability to find a majority to govern.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |title=DIRECT. Législatives : les députés insoumis font leur rentrée des classes à l'Assemblée nationale |url=https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-la-gauche-toujours-a-la-recherche-de-son-premier-ministre-attal-va-reunir-ses-troupes-suivez-notre-direct-09-07-2024-KFPRNEZYJNGW5KAJM4YBZ4CVYU.php |access-date=9 July 2024 |work=Le Parisien |date=9 July 2024 |archive-date=9 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240709042146/https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-la-gauche-toujours-a-la-recherche-de-son-premier-ministre-attal-va-reunir-ses-troupes-suivez-notre-direct-09-07-2024-KFPRNEZYJNGW5KAJM4YBZ4CVYU.php |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="LMlive9"/> while Faure resisted pressure from Macron allies to break away from LFI in order to form a government.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Cassini |first1=Sandrine |title=Le Nouveau Front populaire sous pression pour se mettre d'accord sur un premier ministre |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/article/2024/07/11/au-nouveau-front-populaire-une-course-contre-la-montre-pour-s-accorder-sur-un-premier-ministre_6248509_823448.html |access-date=11 July 2024 |work=Le Monde |date=11 July 2024 |archive-date=11 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240711061647/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/article/2024/07/11/au-nouveau-front-populaire-une-course-contre-la-montre-pour-s-accorder-sur-un-premier-ministre_6248509_823448.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="LMlive12"/> LFI reacted by suspending negotiations, demanding that all parties agree upon on a single candidacy for the presidency of the National Assembly, and refusing the possibility of a civil society figure being appointed prime minister, after which the PS, LE, and PCF pushed for discussions to resume and proposed appointing a civil society figure as prime minister,<ref name="LMlive13"/> Laurence Tubiana,<ref>{{cite news |title=Le PS, les écologistes et les communistes devraient proposer aux insoumis le nom de Laurence Tubiana pour occuper le poste de Premier ministre |url=https://www.francetvinfo.fr/elections/direct-legislatives-2024-le-nouveau-front-populaire-sous-pression-pour-s-accorder-sur-un-nom-de-premier-ministre_6667281.html |access-date=15 July 2024 |work=franceinfo |date=15 July 2024}}</ref>

<ref name="LPlive">{{cite news |title=DIRECT. Législatives : Gérald Darmanin appelle le camp présidentiel à "travailler avec LR" |url=https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/direct-legislatives-un-conseil-des-ministres-a-11h30-laurence-tubiana-proposee-pour-matignon-par-le-ps-et-le-pc-16-07-2024-NGAFO5QLHBCGNLRZJTTFXWXHLU.php |access-date=16 July 2024 |work=Le Parisien |date=16 July 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: Laurent Wauquiez ruled out the possibility of LR participating in a potential coalition just after the results were announced.

references.text: <ref name="LMlive6"/> President of the Senate Republicans|LR group in the Senate Bruno Retailleau ruled out the possibility of working with any coalition of the left, and like others within his party, deemed the LR brand to be "dead."<ref name="LMlive7"/> Despite these statements, some LR figures still called for a pro-Macron alliance in the National Assembly, including Xavier Bertrand and Olivier Marleix.<ref name="LMlive8"/> After being elected president of the group, Wauquiez proclaimed that he would not agree to a coalition but would be open to a "legislative pact," and also signaled that the right would vote for a motion of no confidence if any future government included LFI members,<ref name="LMlive9"/> a position also held by Larcher.<ref name="LMlive10">{{cite news |title=En direct, la situation politique en France : pour François Bayrou, l'impulsion ne viendra pas des partis mais d'Emmanuel Macron qui " devra nommer un premier ministre " rassembleur |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/11/en-direct-la-situation-politique-en-france-les-dernieres-informations-et-reaction-apres-la-nouvelle-lettre-d-emmanuel-macron_6247441_823448.html |access-date=11 July 2024 |work=Le Monde |date=11 July 2024 |archive-date=11 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240711055041/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/11/en-direct-la-situation-politique-en-france-les-dernieres-informations-et-reaction-apres-la-nouvelle-lettre-d-emmanuel-macron_6247441_823448.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: After falling short of pre-election expectations, Le Pen said that the RN's victory "is only postponed" and that she could not be disappointed with the party's gains in the election. Gilles Pennelle, the general director of the party who oversaw the selection of RN candidates, resigned the day after the election. but Le Pen subsequently clarified that the RN would do so in the case that any government contained LFI or LE ministers, regardless of who led it,

references.text: <ref name="LMlive6"/> On 8 July, Sébastien Chenu appeared to express regret about the controversies surrounding many of the candidates who went on to lose their races, and affirmed that the RN would remain in opposition "without compromise,"<ref name="LMlive7"/> and Zoltán Kovács (politician, born 1969)|Zoltán Kovács announced that Bardella would chair the Patriots for Europe group in the European Parliament.<ref>{{cite news|title=Parlement européen : Jordan Bardella va présider un nouveau groupe nationaliste initié par le Premier ministre hongrois, Viktor Orban|url=https://www.francetvinfo.fr/politique/jordan-bardella/parlement-europeen-jordan-bardella-va-presider-un-nouveau-groupe-nationaliste-initie-par-le-premier-ministre-hongrois-viktor-orban_6654060.html|access-date=8 July 2024|work=franceinfo|agency=Agence France-Presse|date=8 July 2024|archive-date=8 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240708222005/https://www.francetvinfo.fr/politique/jordan-bardella/parlement-europeen-jordan-bardella-va-presider-un-nouveau-groupe-nationaliste-initie-par-le-premier-ministre-hongrois-viktor-orban_6654060.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="LMlive7"/> On 11 July, Renaud Labaye initially announced that the RN would not automatically vote for a motion of no confidence in a NFP-led government including LFI members, but rather consider legislative texts on a case-by-case basis,<ref>{{cite news |last1=Bordas |first1=Wally |last2=Gentilhomme |first2=Célestine |title=Législatives : le RN ne censurerait pas automatiquement un gouvernement NFP avec des ministres Insoumis |url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-le-rn-ne-censurerait-pas-automatiquement-un-gouvernement-nfp-avec-des-ministres-insoumis-20240711 |access-date=11 July 2024 |work=Le Figaro |date=11 July 2024 |archive-date=12 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240712025031/https://www.lefigaro.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-le-rn-ne-censurerait-pas-automatiquement-un-gouvernement-nfp-avec-des-ministres-insoumis-20240711 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="LMlive10"/> and Bardella confirmed that they would immediately vote for a motion of no confidence in any NFP minority government.<ref>{{cite news |title=DIRECT. Législatives : le RN censurera "tout gouvernement" avec des ministres insoumis ou écologistes, annonce Marine Le Pen |url=https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/direct-legislatives-macron-estime-que-personne-na-emporte-les-elections-les-oppositions-sinsurgent-11-07-2024-5QOUO66FEJECDEGOYQ7OXTPQWE.php |access-date=11 July 2024 |work=Le Parisien |date=11 July 2024 |archive-date=11 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240711082004/https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/direct-legislatives-macron-estime-que-personne-na-emporte-les-elections-les-oppositions-sinsurgent-11-07-2024-5QOUO66FEJECDEGOYQ7OXTPQWE.php |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Then-Prime Minister Gabriel Attal, having only served six months in office, presented his resignation to  Macron, who accepted it on 16 July. The day before the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympic Games|Paris Olympic Games, the New Popular Front proposed that Lucie Castets be nominated as prime minister. In reaction, arguing that "no one won [the elections]",  Macron announced the holding of consultations to form a government.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news|title=Résultats législatives 2024 : Emmanuel Macron lance les grandes manœuvres (et assure que « personne n'a gagné ») |url=https://www.20minutes.fr/politique/4100751-20240710-resultats-legislatives-2024-emmanuel-macron-lance-grandes-man-uvres-assure-personne-gagne |work=20 Minutes |date=10 July 2024 |access-date=5 September 2024 |language=fr}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 16 August, at the end of the Olympic Games, Macron invited party leaders and presidents of parliamentary groups from both chambers to the Palais de l'Élysée on 23 August to try to form a government. After the President received the party leaders and the presidents of parliamentary groups, Macron's office announced in a press release on 26 August that Castets would not be appointed prime minister.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news|title=Emmanuel Macron convie les chefs de partis le 23 août, pas de Premier ministre dans l'immédiat |url=https://www.lavoixdunord.fr/1492981/article/2024-08-16/emmanuel-macron-convie-les-chefs-de-partie-le-23-aout-pas-de-premier-ministre |work=La Voix du Nord |date=16 August 2024 |access-date=5 September 2024 |language=fr}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news|title=Nouveau gouvernement : Emmanuel Macron refuse de nommer Lucie Castets et lance de nouvelles consultations|url=https://www.lesechos.fr/politique-societe/emmanuel-macron-president/nouveau-gouvernement-emmanuel-macron-refuse-de-nommer-lucie-castets-et-lance-de-nouvelles-consultations-2115247 |work=Les Echos |date=26 August 2024 |access-date=5 September 2024 |language=fr}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 2 September, Emmanuel Macron received nominations from Bernard Cazeneuve, the former Socialist Party (France)|Socialist Party Prime Minister from 2016 to 2017, and Xavier Bertrand, a former Hauts-de-France region president. Faced with the risk of a motion of censure, the candidacy of Michel Barnier was considered on 4 September.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news|language=fr |title=Matignon: Macron "test" Cazeneuve and Bertrand, the Beaudet surprise emerges|url=https://information.tv5monde.com/international/matignon-macron-teste-cazeneuve-et-bertrand-la-surprise-beaudet-emerge-2738073 |work=TV5 Monde |date=2 September 2024 |access-date=5 September 2024}}.</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news|author=|title=Nouveau Premier ministre: Michel Barnier, nouvelle "piste sérieuse" d'Emmanuel Macron?|date=4 September 2024 |url=https://www.bfmtv.com/politique/gouvernement/nouveau-premier-ministre-michel-barnier-nouvelle-piste-serieuse-d-emmanuel-macron_AV-202409040913.htm |work=BFMTV |access-date=5 September 2024 |language=fr}}</ref>

sentences.text:
{{main|Barnier government}}
On 5 September 2024, Michel Barnier was appointed as prime minister by Macron, heading a Parliament divided nearly evenly between the leftist New Popular Front, which holds the plurality of seats, Macron's centrist to centre-right Ensemble, and the far-right National Rally.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news|date=5 September 2024|title=Live blog: Macron names Michel Barnier new prime minister|language=en-GB|work=France24|url=https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20240905-%F0%9F%94%B4-live-blog-macron-names-michel-barnier-new-prime-minister|access-date=5 September 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |date=5 September 2024 |title=Macron’s Choice of French Premier Shows His Ambitions Unraveling |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-09-05/who-is-michel-barnier-france-s-new-prime-minister-and-why-macron-chose-him |access-date=5 September 2024 |work=Bloomberg.com |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: While the NFP has announced it would move a motion of no confidence against any government not led by them, the National Rally announces that it will wait for the general policy statement of the new government before deciding whether to support any motions of no confidence or censure.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news|title=L'ancien ministre Michel Barnier, figure des Républicains, nommé Premier ministre par Emmanuel Macron |date=5 September 2024|url=https://www.francetvinfo.fr/politique/emmanuel-macron/l-ancien-ministre-michel-barnier-figure-des-republicains-nomme-premier-ministre-par-emmanuel-macron_6764575.html |work=Franceinfo |access-date=5 September 2024 |language=fr}}</ref>

sentences.text: Plans for governance were likely to only be solidified after the formation of parliamentary groups in the 17th legislature of the French Fifth Republic clarified the alignment of elected deputies starting on 11 July, which was be followed by the election of the next president of the National Assembly of France on 18 July as well as the appointment of vice presidents, quaestors, and secretaries as part of the {{ill|bureau of the National Assembly of France|fr|Bureau de l'Assemblée nationale française}}. Macron is expected to allow the bloc which is able to elect the next president of the National Assembly to form the next government. Numerous figures on the left also called upon deputies to block the RN from obtaining key posts in the National Assembly, Renaissance deputy Yaël Braun-Pivet was re-elected president of the National Assembly with 220 votes in the third round of voting on 18 July owing to the support of LR deputies, ahead of NFP-supported PCF deputy André Chassaigne with 207. Across 19 and 20 July, the NFP obtained 12 of 22 posts in the bureau of the National Assembly, with the RN shut out of all posts.

Le grand flou à l'issue du second tour des législatives|url=https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/qui-pour-gouverner-le-grand-flou-a-lissue-du-second-tour-des-legislatives-08-07-2024-SI4L2HD6SVHCDAXQ5IM5AG6TBY.php|access-date=8 July 2024|work=Le Parisien|date=8 July 2024|archive-date=8 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240708153600/https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/qui-pour-gouverner-le-grand-flou-a-lissue-du-second-tour-des-legislatives-08-07-2024-SI4L2HD6SVHCDAXQ5IM5AG6TBY.php|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: Shortly after the elections, Clémentine Autain, like Ruffin, announced that she would not join the La France Insoumise group in the incoming legislature, instead hoping to form a new group, with the five of them seeking to form a new group with members of the PCF, LE, and Génération.s and Corbière also expressing his willingness to join a unified NFP group, The five deputies ultimately announced that they would join the Ecologist Group|Ecologist group on 15 July.

references.text: <ref name="LMlive7"/> potentially alongside Christophe Bex and LFI incumbents who managed to win re-election against official LFI candidates including Alexis Corbière, Hendrik Davi, and Danielle Simonnet,<ref>{{cite news|title=Législatives : Autain, Ruffin… ces voix désormais dissidentes qui ne siégeront pas avec La France insoumise|url=https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-autain-ruffin-ces-voix-desormais-dissidentes-qui-ne-siegeront-pas-avec-la-france-insoumise-08-07-2024-VO7D6ZRBHJBH7J6OMBLX33UFEE.php|access-date=8 July 2024|work=Le Parisien|date=8 July 2024|archive-date=8 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240708153610/https://www.leparisien.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-autain-ruffin-ces-voix-desormais-dissidentes-qui-ne-siegeront-pas-avec-la-france-insoumise-08-07-2024-VO7D6ZRBHJBH7J6OMBLX33UFEE.php|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="LMlive8"/> and all but Ruffin announcing the creation of the political movement L'Après on 12 July.<ref name="LMlive11">{{cite news |title=En direct : Fabien Roussel propose Huguette Bello, présidente du conseil régional de La Réunion, à Matignon ; les négociations se poursuivent à gauche |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/12/en-direct-la-situation-politique-en-france-elisabeth-borne-dement-etre-candidate-a-la-presidence-du-groupe-de-deputes-renaissance_6247441_823448.html |access-date=12 July 2024 |work=Le Monde |date=12 July 2024 |archive-date=12 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240712053901/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/12/en-direct-la-situation-politique-en-france-elisabeth-borne-dement-etre-candidate-a-la-presidence-du-groupe-de-deputes-renaissance_6247441_823448.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Of the 22 deputies in the Liberties, Independents, Overseas and Territories (LIOT) group before the snap election was called, 14 were re-elected. Because the group is so close to the threshold of 15 deputies needed, negotiations are likely to make the continuation of the group possible in the new National Assembly. However, Martine Froger and David Taupiac, re-elected with the support of the NFP, declined to comment on the subject, as was the case with Paul Molac, Jean-Luc Warsmann, and Estelle Youssouffa, while Yannick Favennec-Bécot was noncommittal. Michel Castellani, Paul-André Colombani, Charles de Courson, Stéphane Lenormand, Max Mathiasin, Christophe Naegelen, and Olivier Serva are all committed to re-forming the group, while Valérie Létard expressed her desire to assert her "independence" as her predecessor Béatrice Descamps did in the LIOT group. Lenormand was elected president of the group of exactly 15 deputies on 16 July.<ref name="LPlive"/>

sentences.text: The Elysée stated that Macron would wait for the new National Assembly to organise itself before making "the necessary decisions." and was elected on 13 July.<ref name="LMlive12"/>

references.text: <ref name="LMlive7"/> On 12 July, Attal announced that he would be a candidate for the presidency of the Renaissance group and that it would be renamed to the "Together for the Republic group" (''groupe Ensemble pour la République'') as well,<ref>{{cite news |title=En direct : Gabriel Attal officialise sa candidature à la présidence du groupe Renaissance à l'Assemblée nationale |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/12/en-direct-la-situation-politique-en-france-elisabeth-borne-dement-etre-candidate-a-la-presidence-du-groupe-de-deputes-renaissance_6247441_823448.html |access-date=12 July 2024 |work=Le Monde |date=12 July 2024 |archive-date=12 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240712053901/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/12/en-direct-la-situation-politique-en-france-elisabeth-borne-dement-etre-candidate-a-la-presidence-du-groupe-de-deputes-renaissance_6247441_823448.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Renaissance deputy Sacha Houlié, representing the left flank of his party, pleaded with his colleagues to form a new "social democratic" group in the National Assembly, and was able to quickly gather 20 deputies for his initiative. With many elected deputies embittered with Macron, only 33 deputies committed to joining the Renaissance group, with others preferring to maintain their leverage and threatening to leave for Houlié's group or join the MoDem in the event of an alliance with the right, and Houlié officially announced on 10 July that he would not join the Renaissance group, which 40 deputies elected under the banner of Renaissance had yet to join, and instead form his own "ranging from the social right to the socialist left," saying that he didn't "agree with [the pro-Macron line] anymore," adding that he felt closest to the views of Glucksmann.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news|last1=Marie-Leconte|first1=Julie|title=Législatives 2024 : Sacha Houlié réfléchit à constituer un nouveau groupe "social-démocrate" à l'Assemblée nationale|url=https://www.francetvinfo.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-2024-sacha-houlie-reflechit-a-constituer-un-nouveau-groupe-social-democrate-a-l-assemblee-nationale_6653967.html|access-date=8 July 2024|work=franceinfo|date=8 July 2024|archive-date=11 July 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240711024233/https://www.francetvinfo.fr/elections/legislatives/legislatives-2024-sacha-houlie-reflechit-a-constituer-un-nouveau-groupe-social-democrate-a-l-assemblee-nationale_6653967.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="Renaissancegroup">{{cite news |last1=D’Angelo |first1=Robin |last2=Darame |first2=Mariama |title=Le groupe Renaissance à l'Assemblée nationale au bord de la dislocation |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/article/2024/07/10/le-groupe-renaissance-a-l-assemblee-nationale-au-bord-de-la-dislocation_6248297_823448.html |access-date=10 July 2024 |work=Le Monde |date=10 July 2024 |archive-date=11 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240711024229/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/article/2024/07/10/le-groupe-renaissance-a-l-assemblee-nationale-au-bord-de-la-dislocation_6248297_823448.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="LMlive9"/> His efforts were ultimately unsuccessful, with 97 of 98 Renaissance deputies joining the group.<ref name="LMlive12">{{cite news |title=En direct, après les législatives : accusée de " pactiser avec le RN " pour garder la présidence de l'Assemblée, Yaël Braun-Pivet dénonce une polémique " nauséabonde " |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/live/2024/07/13/en-direct-gabriel-attal-elu-a-la-tete-du-groupe-renaissance-promet-de-chercher-a-construire-des-ponts-avec-les-forces-politiques-attachees-a-la-republique_6249323_823448.html |access-date=13 July 2024 |work=Le Monde |date=13 July 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: The Horizons group (National Assembly)|Horizons group will be re-constituted in the new National Assembly,

references.text: <ref name="Renaissancegroup"/> as will the Democratic, MoDem and Independents group|MoDem group to be headed by Marc Fesneau after being elected president on 10 July against Nicolas Turquois and previous group president Jean-Paul Mattei, having already led the group between June 2017 and November 2018. However, as a minister in the current government, he must choose to resign from either the government or as deputy.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Hermans |first1=Thomas |title=Marc Fesneau élu patron des députés MoDem à l'Assemblée nationale, tout en restant ministre de l'Agriculture |url=https://france3-regions.francetvinfo.fr/centre-val-de-loire/loir-cher/blois/marc-fesneau-elu-patron-des-deputes-modem-a-l-assemblee-nationale-tout-en-restant-ministre-de-l-agriculture-3002783.html |access-date=10 July 2024 |work=France 3 Centre-Val de Loire |date=10 July 2024 |archive-date=10 July 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240710190356/https://france3-regions.francetvinfo.fr/centre-val-de-loire/loir-cher/blois/marc-fesneau-elu-patron-des-deputes-modem-a-l-assemblee-nationale-tout-en-restant-ministre-de-l-agriculture-3002783.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: On 9 July, Aurélien Pradié stated that he believed there would no longer be a The Republicans group (National Assembly)|LR group within the National Assembly, expecting a change in both their name and way of operation. On 10 July, Wauquiez, elected as leader of the group upon his return to the National Assembly, announced that the group would change its name to become "The Republican Right" (''La Droite Républicaine'').<ref name="LMlive9"/>
